snippet: The release of Ali Harzi dramatized the lack of progress in any investigation into the attack on Sept. 11 that killed the American ambassador to Libya and three other Americans.
abstract: Ali Harzi, only known suspect jailed in connection with deadly attack on United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, is freed, reportedly for lack of evidence against him; release dramatizes negligible progress in investigation into attack and feebleness of Libya's transitional government since fall of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi.

byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The release of Ali Harzi dramatized the lack of progress in any investigation into the attack on Sept. 11 that killed the American ambassador to Libya and three other Americans.

headline.seo: Ali Harzi, Lone Suspect Held in Benghazi Attack, Is Freed in Tunisia
headline.main: Lone Suspect Held in Benghazi Attack Is Freed in Tunisia
headline.print_headline: Lone Suspect Held in Benghazi Attack Is Freed in Tunisia
